wikipedia_page.main:
Stephen Lee (born 1 October 1990) is a British ice hockey player for Elite Ice Hockey League (EIHL) side Nottingham Panthers and the British national team, who he represented at the 2019 IIHF World Championship.Lee previously played for Nottingham for a decade before returning to fellow EIHL side Guildford Flames in 2019.
He initially agreed to stay in Guildford for a second season in 2020, but due to ongoing coronavirus-induced uncertainty about when or if the 2020-21 Elite League season will start, Lee instead moved to the Alps Hockey League to sign for HC Pustertal Wölfe on August 30, 2020.In May 2021, it was confirmed Lee would return to Nottingham after two years away from the club.

response: On 5 January 2022, Nottingham parted company with head coach Tim Wallace following a poor run of form that saw the club slip to sixth in the Elite League standings with a 9-10 record. Player/Assistant coach Mark Matheson and captain Stephen Lee were placed in interim charge. The decision to move on from Wallace came just over a week after the passing of Panthers GM Gary Moran.
Stephen Lee, Steven Lee or Steve Lee may refer to:
* Stephen Lee (TV presenter) (born 1972), English TV presenter
* Stephen Lee (snooker player) (born 1974), English snooker player
* Stephen Lee (ice hockey) (born 1990), English ice hockey player
* Stephen Lee (speed skater) (born 1978), Australian ice speed skater
* Stephen Lee (chemist) (born 1956), American chemistry professor at Cornell University
* Stephen Lee (bishop) (born 1956), Roman Catholic priest, bishop of Macau
* Stephen Lee (South African activist), South African apartheid era political activist, who escaped from the high-security Pretoria Central Prison with Tim Jenkin
